children.name: Example
children.text: (function(engine) { if (current.getValue("state") == "failed") { engine.finding.increment(); } })(engine);
children.text2: The following shows how to count the number of records with a failed state in a table type check. For more information, see Create a table type check.

children.name: increment()
children.text: Increases the count of the current finding.
children.text2:
The finding count starts at zero for each record that a check analyzes in a scan. When called, this method increments the finding count. The count indicates that a finding is to be generated for the current record.

This method can be called multiple times to signify that this finding has multiple occurrences of a check violation in the current record.

children.name: Example
children.text: (function(engine) { engine.rootNode.visit(function(node) { if (node.getTypeName() === "NAME" && node.getNameIdentifier() === "soughtFunction" && node.getParent().getTypeName() === "CALL") { engine.finding.incrementWithNode(node); } }); })(engine);
children.text2: The following shows how to increment linter type nodes in a linter check. For information on using linter check methods, see LinterCheckAstNode API.

children.name: node
children.text: Object
children.text2: Node object from the linter check.

children.name: incrementWithNode(Object node)
children.text:
If the current finding is from a linter check, this method increments the current
    finding count and simultaneously passes the linter node object to the finding.
children.text2:
Use this method in the Script field in the Linter Check form. This method saves information about the given node, such as a line number in a current finding's details column.

See also:

  • Advanced linter check scripts
  • LinterCheckAstNode API

children.name: Example
children.text: (function(engine) { var gr = new GlideRecord('incident'); gr.get('2f99f330730210100a5310c92bf6a798'); engine.finding.setCurrentSource(gr); engine.finding.increment(); })(engine);
children.text2: The following shows how to set the current source to an incident record in a script only check. For more information, see Create a script only check.

children.name: source
children.text: GlideRecord
children.text2:
The record to set as the source record for the current finding. This value is
                added as a reference in the Source field of the Scan Findings [scan_finding]
                table.

children.name: setCurrentSource(GlideRecord source)
children.text: Sets the source of the current finding based on the provided GlideRecord.
children.text2: Use this method in the Script field of a Script Only check. This method is not used for any other checks because they automatically set the source as the current record during the scan. For more information, see Create a script only check.

name: Findings API
text: Provides methods for handling how an Instance Scan check produces findings.
text2:
This API is included with the Instance Scan (com.glide.instance_scan) plugin. For more information, see Instance Scan.

In Instance Scan, checks run on each record in the scope of a scan on the instance to generate findings. Each finding holds information about an issue record and which check it violated. Findings API methods are used in Instance Scan checks as part of the engine object passed to the user. Add the code to the Script field in the check form.

See also:
  • Getting started with checks
  • Findings

children.name: String
children.text:
If the linter object is a name node type, return the name as a string. Null
                otherwise.

children.name: Example
children.text: (function(engine) { engine.rootNode.visit(function(node) { if (node.getTypeName() === "NAME" && node.getNameIdentifier() === "soughtFunction" && node.getParent().getTypeName() === "CALL") { engine.finding.incrementWithNode(node); } }); })(engine);
children.text2: The following uses the Findings API incrementWithNode() method in a linter check. Use this method in the Script field of the Linter Check form.

children.name: getNameIdentifier()
children.text:
Retrieves the string value of a name node type. A name node represents a simple
    identifier that is not a keyword, such as a function or variable name.

children.name: Object
children.text: Parent node object of the accessed node.

children.name: Example
children.text: (function(engine) { engine.rootNode.visit(function(node) { if (node.getTypeName() === "NAME" && node.getNameIdentifier() === "soughtFunction" && node.getParent().getTypeName() === "CALL") { engine.finding.incrementWithNode(node); } }); })(engine);
children.text2: The following uses the Findings API incrementWithNode() method in a linter check. Use this method in the Script field of the Linter Check form.

children.name: getParent()
children.text: Gets the parent node object of the accessed node.

children.name: String
children.text: Type name of the accessed node. For example, a function call in the source is tokenized as a node with the type name of CALL.

children.name: Example
children.text: (function(engine) { engine.rootNode.visit(function(node) { if (node.getTypeName() === "NAME" && node.getNameIdentifier() === "soughtFunction" && node.getParent().getTypeName() === "CALL") { engine.finding.incrementWithNode(node); } }); })(engine);
children.text2: The following uses the Findings API incrementWithNode() method in a linter check. Use this method in the Script field of the Linter Check form.

children.name: getTypeName()
children.text: Gets the type of the accessed node.

children.name: Example
children.text: (function(engine) { engine.rootNode.visit(function(node) { if (node.getTypeName() === "NAME" && node.getNameIdentifier() === "soughtFunction" && node.getParent().getTypeName() === "CALL") { engine.finding.incrementWithNode(node); } }); })(engine);
children.text2: The following uses the Findings API incrementWithNode() method in a linter check. Use this method in the Script field of the Linter Check form.

children.name: callbackFunction
children.text: Function
children.text2:
Callback function to be executed on each node in the subtree of this node. This
                callback function takes a node as a parameter which is the node to be
                visited.

children.name: visit(Function callbackFunction)
children.text:
Accesses each node in the subtree starting from this node and executes a given callback
    function on each node.

name: LinterCheckAstNode API
text:
Provides methods for getting abstract syntax tree (AST) node details in linter
    checks.
text2:
This API is included with the Instance Scan (com.glide.instance_scan) plugin. For more information, see Instance Scan.

Use the methods in this class to run linter checks on AST node types by adding code to the Script field in the Linter Check form. For more information, see Advanced linter check scripts.

Create a linter check to identify any issues in a script. When a linter check is run on a record, an abstract syntax tree for its code is generated. You can use the abstract syntax tree to analyze issues with the code.

Access methods in this API using the Instance Scan engine.rootNode object.
